sen.j: 近衛 尚子（このえ ひさこ、元禄15年3月9日 (旧暦)（1702年4月5日） - 享保5年1月20日 (旧暦)（1720年2月27日））は、江戸時代の中御門天皇の女御で、桜町天皇の生母。
sen.e: Hisako KONOE (April 5, 1702-February 27, 1720) was a nyogo of the Emperor Nakamikado in the Edo period, and the real mother of the Emperor Sakuramachi.
Hisako KONOE (April 5, 1702-February 27, 1720) was Nyogo (a wife of Emperor) of the Emperor Nakamikado in the Edo period, who was the real mother of the Emperor Sakuramachi.
sen.cmt: nyogo→Nyogo (a wife fo Emperor)に訂正しました。And をwho wasに訂正しました。
sen.e: Hisako KONOE (April 5, 1702-February 27, 1720) was Nyogo (a wife of Emperor) of the Emperor Nakamikado in the Edo period, who was the real mother of the Emperor Sakuramachi.

sen.j: 女院号は新中和門院（しんちゅうかもんいん）。
sen.e: Her nyoingo was Shinchukamonin.
Her "nyoingo" (the title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) was Shinchukamonin.
sen.cmt: nyoingo→"nyoingo" (the title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) に訂正しました。
sen.e: Her "nyoingo" (the title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) was Shinchukamonin.

sen.j: 摂政関白太政大臣近衛家熙の娘。
sen.e: The daughter of Iehiro KONOE, Sessho Kanpaku and Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister).
She was the daughter of Iehiro KONOE, "Sessho Kanpaku" (Imperial Regent and Chief adviser to the Emperor) and "Daijo-daijin" (Grand Minister).
sen.cmt: She wasを追加しました。摂政、関白の英訳を追加しました。出典；英辞郎
sen.e: She was the daughter of Iehiro KONOE, "Sessho Kanpaku" (Imperial Regent and Chief adviser to the Emperor) and "Daijo-daijin" (Grand Minister).

sen.j: 生母は権中納言町尻兼量の娘・町尻量子。
sen.e: Her real mother was Kazuko MACHIJIRI, the daughter of Kanekazu MACHIJIRI, Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor).
Her real mother was Kazuko MACHIJIRI, the daughter of Kanekazu MACHIJIRI who was Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councillor of state).
sen.cmt: who wasを追加しました。Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state)に訂正しました（定訳より）。
sen.e: Her real mother was Kazuko MACHIJIRI, the daughter of Kanekazu MACHIJIRI who was Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councillor of state).

sen.j: 異母兄に関白太政大臣近衛家久がいる。
sen.e: Her older paternal half-brother was Iehisa KONOE, Kanpaku Dajodaijin (imperial regent and grand minister).
She had the older paternal half-brother, Iehisa KONOE who was Kanpaku Dajodaijin (Imperial Regent and Grand Minister).
sen.cmt: Her→She had theに訂正しました。Who wasを追加しました。
sen.e: She had the older paternal half-brother, Iehisa KONOE who was Kanpaku Dajodaijin (Imperial Regent and Grand Minister).

sen.j: なお入内に際し、正室の近衛熈子が伯母にあたる縁から、江戸幕府第6代征夷大将軍徳川家宣の猶子となっている。
sen.e: When she got married, she became the adopted child of Ienobu TOKUGAWA, the sixth Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), since his lawful wife Hiroko KONOE was Hisako's aunt.

When she got married, she became the adopted child of Ienobu TOKUGAWA, the sixth Seii taishogun (literally, "great General who subdues the barbarians") of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), because his lawful wife Hiroko KONOE was Hisako's aunt.
sen.cmt: general→Generalに訂正しました。Since→becauseに訂正しました。
sen.e: When she got married, she became the adopted child of Ienobu TOKUGAWA, the sixth Seii taishogun (literally, "great General who subdues the barbarians") of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), because his lawful wife Hiroko KONOE was Hisako's aunt.

sen.j: 享保元年（1716年）、中御門天皇に入内し、女御宣下を受ける。
sen.e: In 1716, she married the Emperor Nakamikado and received the Imperial letter of appointment as Nyogo.
In 1716 she married the Emperor Nakamikado and received the Imperial letter of appointment as the title Nyogo.
In 1716 she married the Emperor Nakamikado and received the Imperial letter of appointment as the title Nyogo.

sen.j: 享保5年1月1日 (旧暦)（1720年2月8日）、第一皇子・昭仁親王（のちの桜町天皇）を出産する。
sen.e: On February 8, 1720, she gave birth to their first Prince, Imperial Prince Teruhito (later Emperor Sakuramachi).
On February 8, 1720, she gave birth to the first son, Imperial Prince Teruhito (later the Emperor Sakuramachi).
sen.cmt: their first prince→the first sonに訂正しました。
sen.e: On February 8, 1720, she gave birth to the first son, Imperial Prince Teruhito (later the Emperor Sakuramachi).

sen.j: しかし、難産のため産後の肥立ちが悪く、同月20日に没。
sen.e: However, it was a difficult delivery and she was doing bad after one's confinement, and she died on February 20th.
However, it was such a difficult delivery that it made her seriously ill; She died on February 20 in the same year.
sen.cmt: suchを追加し、that it made her seriously ill; に訂正しました。20th→20に訂正しました。In the same yearを追加しました。
sen.e: However, it was such a difficult delivery that it made her seriously ill; She died on February 20 in the same year.
Died at the age of 19.
She died at the age of 19.
She died at the age of 19.

sen.j: その後、准后並びに女院号を追贈され、月輪陵（京都府京都市東山区）に葬られた。
sen.e: Later she was conferred court rank (jugo and nyoingo) posthumously, and buried in Tsukinowa no misasagi (the Tsukinowa Mausoleum) (Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture).
She was conferred the court titles, "Jugo" and "Nyoingo" after her death; She was buried at Tsukinowa no misasagi (the Tsukinowa Mausoleum) (in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: Laterを削除しました。Court rank→the court titlesに訂正しました。jugo and nyoingo→"Jugo" and "Nyoingo"に訂正しました。In→atに訂正しました。
sen.e: She was conferred the court titles, "Jugo" and "Nyoingo" after her death; She was buried at Tsukinowa no misasagi (the Tsukinowa Mausoleum) (in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 追って享保13年（1728年）6月には皇太后を追贈され、同年11月には所生の昭仁親王が正式に皇太子に立てられている。
sen.e: In June 1728, the Empress Dowager was conferred and her birth child Imperial Prince Teruhito formally became the Prince in November the same year.
In June 1728, the title Empress Dowager was conferred to her; Her birth child, Imperial Prince Teruhito officially became the Crown Prince in November of the same year.
sen.cmt: conferredにto herを追加しました。the Prince→the Crown Princeに訂正しました。The same yearの前にofを追加しました。
sen.e: In June 1728, the title Empress Dowager was conferred to her; Her birth child, Imperial Prince Teruhito officially became the Crown Prince in November of the same year.
